newsitem.title: POLAND: Swarzedz sees '97 sales up to PLN 171 mln.
newsitem.headline: Swarzedz sees '97 sales up to PLN 171 mln.

text.p: Polish furniture maker Swarzedz SA sees its 1997 sales rising to 170.9 million zlotys, up from last year's 106.9 million, the company said in a statement on Thursday.

Swarzedz also said it wanted to double its export to between 47 and 63 percent of overall sales, which would be possible thanks to its contract with German firm International Moebelhandelskantor Gmbh & Co KH (IMK).
Swarzedz expects to sell IMK furniture worth total 55.6 million zlotys in 1997.
The company did not give any profit forecasts.

Swarzedz, which had a net loss of 38.9 million zlotys last year, seeks a debt restructuring deal and wants to earmark 3.12 million shares of its new share issue of up to 6.6 million shares for a debt-for-equity scheme.
